answerText: Palace Walk [or Between the Two Palaces; or Bayn al-qasrayn][10] Palace Walk is the first entry of the Cairo Trilogy written by this Egyptian Nobel Laureate, who wrote about the historic assassination of Sadat in The Day the Leader Was Killed.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | South Carolina and Carlton | 15 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One character in this novel is hit by a car on the one occasion that she does leave her house at the urging of her children and in direct defiance of her husband. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel about the family of Al-Sayyid Ahmad Abd al-Jawad, who in its opening pages returns at an ungodly hour partying in a decidedly un-Islamic fashion to his wife Amina, who stays up waiting for him.
